definition[0]: what is left after everything or everyone else has gone or been used, dealt with, or mentioned
example[0]: You carry these two bags, and I’ll bring the rest.
example[1]: Two of the attackers were killed, and the rest escaped.
example[2]: Does anyone want the rest of this pizza?
example[3]: He’ll be in a wheelchair for the rest of his life.
explanation[0]: You use a singular verb after the rest when referring to an uncountable noun
example[4]: The rest of the money is for you
example[5]: I’ve eaten some cheese – the rest is in the fridge
explanation[1]: You use a plural verb after the rest when referring to a group of people or things
example[6]: Two of the terrorists were captured and the rest were killed
